Package io.github.bluelhf.tasks

Class Task<P,​R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.bluelhf.tasks.Task<P,​R>
  • public abstract class Task<P,​R>
extends Object
    A task represents some code that can update its progress to outsiders, and returns some result. Tasks can be run asynchronously, which is useful for creating parallel threads that communicate with each other.

    To create tasks, use of(Function)

    See Also:
    of(Function), Observable

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  Task.Delegate
      A task delegate used when creating new tasks.

    • Method Detail

      • of

        public static <P,​R> Task<P,​R> of​(Function<Task.Delegate,​R> supplierFunction)
        Creates a new task using the delegate-result function.
        Type Parameters:
        P - The type of progress the task has, used for setProgress(Object)
        R - The resulting type of the task, an instance of which the delegate-result function will return.
        Parameters:
        supplierFunction - The delegate-result function, which accepts a task delegate and returns the task's result.
        Returns:
        The created task.

      • run

        public R run()
        Runs this task synchronously.
        Returns:
        The result of this task.

      • runAsync

        public CompletableFuture<R> runAsync()
        Runs this task asynchronously using ForkJoinPool.commonPool().
        Returns:
        The CompletableFuture used to run the task.

      • runAsync

        public CompletableFuture<R> runAsync​(Executor executor)
        Runs this task asynchronously using the given Executor
        Parameters:
        executor - The executor to use.
        Returns:
        The CompletableFuture used to run the task.

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancels the task. Cancels this task if it is running asynchronously, generating an InterruptedException.

      • getBackingFuture

        public CompletableFuture<R> getBackingFuture()
        Returns the CompletableFuture used to run this task.
        Returns:
        The CompletableFuture used to run this task if this task is running asynchronously.

      • isCompleted

        public boolean isCompleted()
        Checks whether the task has completed or not.
        Returns:
        True if this task has completed, false otherwise.

      • getProgress

        public P getProgress()
        Returns the current progress of this task.
        Returns:
        The current progress of this task.

      • getResult

        public R getResult()
        Returns the result of this task.
        Returns:
        The result of this task, or null if none is set.

      • whileRunning

        public Task<P,​R> whileRunning​(Consumer<P> progressConsumer,
                                    Duration period)
        Runs the given Consumer every period as long as the task is running, and once when the task completes.
        Parameters:
        progressConsumer - The consumer to run every period
        period - How often to run the consumer.
        Returns:
        This task

      • onProgress

        public Task<P,​R> onProgress​(BiConsumer<P,​P> progressConsumer)
        Adds a progress listener to this Task. If this task is already completed, then the listener will be called immediately with duplicate progress values.
        Parameters:
        progressConsumer - The progress listener, accepting both the old and new value for the progress.
        Returns:
        This task, with the new progress listener.

      • onResult

        public Task<P,​R> onResult​(Consumer<R> resultConsumer)
        Adds a result listener to this Task. If this task is already completed, then the listener will be called immediately with the result.
        Parameters:
        resultConsumer - The result listener to add, accepting the value of the result.
        Returns:
        This task, with the new result listener.
